## Functions

### MakeErrMsg() {#a4a66e59cba198d78f4f5a80c1284a666}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool MakeErrMsg (<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#ae2b0d0345572d6718e219aa76d1d54edab45cffe084dd3d20d928bee85e7b0f21">std::string</a> &#42; ErrMsg, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#ae2b0d0345572d6718e219aa76d1d54edab45cffe084dd3d20d928bee85e7b0f21">std::string</a> &amp; prefix, int errnum=-1)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
This function builds an error message into <code>ErrMsg</code> using the <code>prefix</code> string and the Unix error number given by <code>errnum</code>.

If errnum is -1, the default then the value of errno is used. Make an error message

If the error number can be converted to a string, it will be separated from prefix by &quot;: &quot;.

Definition at line <a href="#l00053">53</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/unix/unix-h">Unix.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>

Definition at line <a href="#l00064">64</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/unix/unix-h">Unix.h</a>.
